vaultlootbeams.config.title: VaultLootBeams Config
vaultlootbeams.config.listSyntax: All item lists entries can be any of the following: {modid}:{item} (that item only), #{tag} (all items in the tag), or {modid} (all items in the mod).
vaultlootbeams.config.renderDistance.too: How close the player has to be to see the beam. (note: in vanilla items stop rendering at 24 blocks.)
vaultlootbeams.config.requireGround.tool: If the item needs to be on the ground to render the Loot Beam.
vaultlootbeams.config.renderCondition.to: The general requirement for an item to render a Loot Beam.
vaultlootbeams.config.renderWhitelist.to: Items that should render a loot beam regardless of the render condition.
vaultlootbeams.config.renderBlacklist.to: Items that should not render a loot beam no matter what.
vaultlootbeams.config.beamYOffset.toolti: The Y offset of the beam.
vaultlootbeams.config.whiteBeamCenter.to: Should the beam render a white center beam.
vaultlootbeams.config.beamShadow.tooltip: Should the beam render a glowing shadow.
vaultlootbeams.config.shadowAlphaMultipl: A multiplier applied to the shadow's alpha.
vaultlootbeams.config.animateShadow.tool: Should the beam's shadow be animated with the item bobbing.
vaultlootbeams.config.beamRenderMode.too: Controls the texture and shader of the beam.
vaultlootbeams.config.beamColorMode.tool: What should determine the color of the beam.
vaultlootbeams.config.colorOverrides: You cannot edit color overrides in the gui, you must edit the config file directly.
vaultlootbeams.config.beamParticles.tool: Should any beam particles be rendered.
vaultlootbeams.config.particleCount.tool: How many particles should spawn per second.
vaultlootbeams.config.particleLifetime.t: The lifetime of the particles in ticks.
The general condition for particles to render.
Items that should render particles regardless of the render condition.
Items that should not render particles no matter what.
vaultlootbeams.config.beamNameplate.tool: Should any nameplates be rendered. Nameplates consist of the item name, count(configurable), and rarity(configurable).
vaultlootbeams.config.nameplateOnLook.to: Should the nameplate render when looking at items.
vaultlootbeams.config.nameplateLookSensi: How close the player has to look at the item to render the nametag.
vaultlootbeams.config.nameplateOutline.t: Should the nameplate be bordered. Set to false for flat nametag with a background.
vaultlootbeams.config.nameplateIncludeCo: Should the nameplate include the item count.
vaultlootbeams.config.renderVanillaRarit: Should vanilla rarities be rendered below the nameplate.
vaultlootbeams.config.customNameplateRar: Any custom rarities you want to render below the nameplate. (Must be the line below the item name)
vaultlootbeams.config.nameplateCondition: The general condition for nameplates to render.
vaultlootbeams.config.nameplateWhitelist: Items that should render nameplates regardless of the render condition.
vaultlootbeams.config.nameplateBlacklist: Items that should not render nameplates no matter what.
vaultlootbeams.config.landingSound.toolt: Should a sound play when the item lands.
vaultlootbeams.config.soundCondition.too: The general condition for the sound to play.
vaultlootbeams.config.soundWhitelist.too: Items that should play a sound regardless of the render condition.
vaultlootbeams.config.soundBlacklist.too: Items that should not play a sound no matter what.
